docs.title: Welcome to MkDocs
docs.text: For full documentation visit mkdocs.org.

docs.title: Commands
docs.text:
• mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project.
  • mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server.
  • mkdocs build - Build the documentation site.
  • mkdocs -h - Print help message and exit.

docs.text: A comprehensive guide to getting the most out of MkDocs and Material for MkDocs.

docs.title: Exclude Pages from Search
docs.text:
Configure which pages should be excluded from search results:

# mkdocs.yml
plugins:
  - search:
      exclude:
        - tags.md
        - archive/*

docs.title: Boost Search Ranking
docs.text:
Make important pages rank higher in search results by adding frontmatter:

---
search:
  boost: 2
---
# Important Page

docs.title: Auto-Generated API Documentation
docs.text:
For Python projects, use mkdocstrings to automatically generate API documentation from docstrings:

pip install mkdocstrings[python]

# mkdocs.yml
plugins:
  - mkdocstrings:
      handlers:
        python:
          options:
            show_source: true
            show_root_heading: true

Then in your markdown files:

::: your_module.your_class
    options:
      show_source: true
      members_order: source

docs.title: Version Management
docs.text:
Use mike for managing multiple documentation versions with a dropdown selector:

pip install mike

# Deploy version 1.0
mike deploy --push --update-aliases 1.0 latest

# Deploy version 2.0
mike deploy --push --update-aliases 2.0 latest

# mkdocs.yml
extra:
  version:
    provider: mike

docs.title: Content Tabs with Memory
docs.text:
Enable tabs that remember user's language preference across pages:

# mkdocs.yml
markdown_extensions:
  - pymdownx.tabbed:
      alternate_style: true
      slugify: !!python/object/apply:pymdownx.slugs.slugify
        kwds:
          case: lower

Example usage:

=== "Python"

    ```python
    print("Hello, World!")
    ```

=== "JavaScript"

    ```javascript
    console.log("Hello, World!");
    ```

=== "Rust"

    ```rust
    println!("Hello, World!");
    ```

docs.title: Mermaid Diagrams
docs.text:
Add support for Mermaid diagrams directly in your markdown:

# mkdocs.yml
markdown_extensions:
  - pymdownx.superfences:
      custom_fences:
        - name: mermaid
          class: mermaid
          format: !!python/name:pymdownx.superfences.fence_code_format

Example diagram:

```mermaid
graph LR
    A[Start] --> B{Is it working?}
    B -->|Yes| C[Great!]
    B -->|No| D[Debug]
    D --> B
```

docs.title: Interactive Code Annotations
docs.text:
Add numbered annotations to code blocks that show on hover:

```python
def greet(name: str) -> str:
    return f"Hello {name}!"  # (1)
```

1. This is an annotation that appears on hover!

docs.title: Include External Files
docs.text:
Include content from external files using snippets:

# mkdocs.yml
markdown_extensions:
  - pymdownx.snippets:
      base_path: .

Usage examples:

<!-- Include entire file -->
--8<-- "README.md"

<!-- Include specific lines (10-20) -->
--8<-- "src/example.py:10:20"

<!-- Include from line 10 to end -->
--8<-- "src/example.py:10:"

docs.title: Custom Homepage
docs.text:
Create a custom homepage with cards by adding a custom directory:

# mkdocs.yml
theme:
  features:
    - content.action.edit
  custom_dir: overrides

Create overrides/home.html:

{% extends "base.html" %}

{% block content %}
<div class="md-typeset">
  <h1>Welcome to Our Documentation!</h1>
  <div class="grid cards">
    <a href="{{ 'getting-started/' | url }}" class="card">
      <h2>📚 Getting Started</h2>
      <p>New to the project? Start here!</p>
    </a>
    <a href="{{ 'api/' | url }}" class="card">
      <h2>🔧 API Reference</h2>
      <p>Complete API documentation</p>
    </a>
    <a href="{{ 'examples/' | url }}" class="card">
      <h2>💡 Examples</h2>
      <p>Learn by example</p>
    </a>
  </div>
</div>
{% endblock %}

docs.text:
Create docs/404.md:

docs.title: Blog Plugin
docs.text:
Add a blog section for news and updates:

plugins:
  - blog:
      blog_dir: blog
      post_dir: "{blog}/posts"
      post_date_format: medium
      archive: true
      categories: true

docs.title: Keyboard Keys Styling
docs.text:
markdown_extensions:
  - pymdownx.keys

Usage:

Press ++ctrl+alt+del++ to restart

Common shortcuts:
- ++cmd+c++ : Copy
- ++cmd+v++ : Paste
- ++ctrl+shift+i++ : Open Developer Tools

docs.title: Environment-Specific Configurations
docs.text:
Create multiple configuration files:

# mkdocs.yml (base configuration)
site_name: My Project
theme:
  name: material

# mkdocs.dev.yml (development)
INHERIT: mkdocs.yml
site_url: http://localhost:8000
strict: false

# mkdocs.prod.yml (production)
INHERIT: mkdocs.yml
site_url: https://doc.kaboli.xyz
strict: true

Usage:

# Development
mkdocs serve -f mkdocs.dev.yml

# Production build
mkdocs build -f mkdocs.prod.yml

docs.title: Copy Button for Code Blocks
docs.text:
theme:
  features:
    - content.code.copy
    - content.code.select  # Allow selecting specific lines
    - content.code.annotate  # Enable annotations

docs.title: URL Redirects
docs.text:
Handle moved or renamed pages gracefully:

plugins:
  - redirects:
      redirect_maps:
        'old-page.md': 'new-page.md'
        'guide/old.md': 'guide/new.md'
        'deprecated.md': 'https://external-site.com'

docs.title: Math Support (LaTeX)
docs.text:
markdown_extensions:
  - pymdownx.arithmatex:
      generic: true

extra_javascript:
  - javascripts/mathjax.js
  - https://polyfill.io/v3/polyfill.min.js?features=es6
  - https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/mathjax@3/es5/tex-mml-chtml.js

Create docs/javascripts/mathjax.js:

window.MathJax = {
  tex: {
    inlineMath: [["\\(", "\\)"]],
    displayMath: [["\\[", "\\]"]],
    processEscapes: true,
    processEnvironments: true
  },
  options: {
    ignoreHtmlClass: ".*|",
    processHtmlClass: "arithmatex"
  }
};

Usage:

Inline math: $\sqrt{x^2 + y^2}$

Display math:

$$
E = mc^2
$$

docs.title: Analytics with Feedback
docs.text:
extra:
  analytics:
    provider: google

docs.title: Useful Commands
docs.text:
# Live reload with dirty reload (faster)
mkdocs serve --dirtyreload

# Verbose output for debugging
mkdocs serve --verbose

# Build with strict mode (fails on warnings)
mkdocs build --strict

# Clean build
mkdocs build --clean

# Preview production build
python -m http.server 8000 --directory site

docs.title: Pre-commit Hooks
docs.text:
Create .pre-commit-config.yaml:

repos:
  - repo: https://github.com/pre-commit/pre-commit-hooks
    rev: v4.4.0
    hooks:
      - id: check-yaml
      - id: end-of-file-fixer
      - id: trailing-whitespace
  - repo: local
    hooks:
      - id: mkdocs-build
        name: Build MkDocs
        entry: mkdocs build --strict
        language: system
        pass_filenames: false

docs.title: Custom Variables
docs.text:
Define reusable variables:

# mkdocs.yml
extra:
  version: 1.2.3
  company: YourCompany
  github_repo: https://github.com/yourusername/yourrepo

Use in markdown:

Current version: {{ config.extra.version }}

© 2024 {{ config.extra.company }}

[View on GitHub]({{ config.extra.github_repo }})

docs.title: Performance Optimization
docs.text:
plugins:
  - minify:
      minify_html: true
      minify_js: true
      minify_css: true
      htmlmin_opts:
        remove_comments: true
  - optimize:
      enabled: !ENV [OPTIMIZE, true]

docs.title: Admonitions (Callout Boxes)
docs.text:
Enable various types of callout boxes:

markdown_extensions:
  - admonition
  - pymdownx.details
  - pymdownx.superfences

Usage examples:

!!! note "Custom Title"
    This is a note with a custom title.

!!! warning
    This is a warning without a custom title.

!!! tip "Pro Tip"
    Use these callouts to highlight important information!

!!! danger "Critical"
    This is for critical warnings.

??? question "Collapsible Question"
    This is a collapsible section that starts closed.

???+ example "Expanded by Default"
    This collapsible section starts open.

docs.title: Advanced Theme Customization
docs.text:
theme:
  name: material
  palette:
    # Light mode
    - scheme: default
      primary: indigo
      accent: indigo
      toggle:
        icon: material/brightness-7
        name: Switch to dark mode
    # Dark mode
    - scheme: slate
      primary: indigo
      accent: indigo
      toggle:
        icon: material/brightness-4
        name: Switch to light mode
  features:
    # Navigation
    - navigation.instant
    - navigation.tracking
    - navigation.tabs
    - navigation.tabs.sticky
    - navigation.sections
    - navigation.expand
    - navigation.path
    - navigation.prune
    - navigation.indexes
    - navigation.top
    - toc.follow
    - toc.integrate
    # Search
    - search.suggest
    - search.highlight
    - search.share
    # Content
    - content.code.copy
    - content.code.select
    - content.code.annotate
    - content.tabs.link
    - content.tooltips
    # Header
    - header.autohide
    - announce.dismiss

docs.title: Use Descriptive Headers
docs.text:
• Use clear, action-oriented headers
  • Keep headers concise but descriptive
  • Use proper hierarchy (don't skip levels)

docs.title: Provide Context
docs.text:
• Start each page with a brief overview
  • Explain why something matters before how to do it
  • Link to related documentation

docs.title: Include Examples
docs.text:
• Show real-world use cases
  • Provide complete, working examples
  • Include both simple and complex examples

docs.title: Make it Scannable
docs.text:
• Use bullet points for lists
  • Bold key terms and important points
  • Keep paragraphs short
  • Use tables for comparisons

docs.title: Test Your Docs
docs.text:
• Follow your own instructions
  • Have someone else review
  • Keep examples up to date
  • Test all code snippets
